Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Faints \Faints\, n. pl. The impure spirit which comes over first and last in the distillation of whisky; -- the former being called the strong faints, and the latter, which is much more abundant, the weak faints. This crude spirit is much impregnated with fusel oil. --Ure. [1913 Webster]
